'''v0.9.0 alpha''' is a major update to ''[[Pocket Edition|Minecraft: Pocket Edition]]'' that was released on July 10, 2014. It adds new blocks, mobs, generated structures, infinite worlds as well as other features, changes, and fixes.

=== Gameplay ===
'''Hotbar'''
* Interact button 
** Located above the hotbar. 
** Current actions: 
*** Ignite button for creepers
*** Shear button for sheep
*** Milk button for cows
*** Tame button to tame animals.

'''[[Render distance]]'''
* Ability to set it to 512-block (32 chunks)
** Available for certain supported devices only

'''Advanced World Options'''
* Option to select the world's type
** [[Old]]
*** 256×256
** [[Superflat|Flat]]
*** Infinite and by default generates with the Classic Superflat and can only be changed by editing the options.txt file.<ref>{{tweet|tomcc|479177777103769600|Hey modders, what about sand flatworlds? Hint- this is a thing in the next build: 'game_flatworldlayers:[7, 12,12,12&#93;'|18 Jun 2014}}</ref>
** Infinite 
*** Reliable playing size is 65,536×65,536 (+32,767 to -32,767)
*** After going past ±32,767, [[Bedrock Edition distance effects|distance effects]] start to take appear.<ref>{{reddit|sub=Minecraft|27pae1|pocket_edition_090_snapshot/ci3sj7v}}</ref> The "jitteriness" gradually increases when the distance from the center is increased every power of 2, as well as frequency of crashes and other glitches such as distorted block models.
*** Eventually, natural phenomena such as the [[Stripe Lands]] and [[Far Lands]] occur, making it impossible to continue without using 3rd party tools. <ref>{{reddit|sub=MCPE|27woze|welcome_to_the_mcpe_farlands}}</ref><ref>{{reddit|sub=Minecraft|27yjjx|z_900k_i_broke_water}}</ref><ref>{{reddit|sub=MCPE|280337|i_found_the_edge_far_lands_in_mcpe}}</ref>

'''[[Mobs#Tameable|Taming]]'''

'''[[Zombie siege]]s'''

'''[[Particles]]'''
* <code>dripWater</code>
* <code>dripLava</code>

== Changes ==
=== Blocks ===
'''[[Bed]]'''
* No longer restores health

'''[[Birch Log|Birch]], [[Spruce Log|Spruce]] and [[Jungle Log|Jungle Wood]]'''
* Now have separate textures

'''[[Carpets]]'''
* Obtainable in survival mode

'''[[Gravel]]'''
* No longer falls from spawn

'''[[Jungle Leaves]]'''
* Now permanently opaque

'''[[Jungle Planks|Jungle Wood Planks]]'''
* Can now be crafted

'''[[Lava]] and [[Water]]'''
* Now insta-tick

'''[[Leaves]]'''
* New rendering

=== Items ===
'''[[Gray dye]] and [[light gray dye]]'''
* Can now be obtained in survival

* [[Saddle]]s
* Can now generate in village blacksmith chests

'''[[Snow]]'''
* Now is craftable

=== Non-mob entities ===
'''[[TNT]] [[explosion]]'''
* Improved performance

=== World generation ===
'''[[Tree#Cold-en oak trees|Cold-en oak trees]]'''
* No longer generate in maps with the new terrain.

'''[[Oak trees]] '''
* Generate with different heights and structures.

'''Old terrain '''
* Removed for [[Old]] world type

'''[[Gravel Beaches]]'''
* Removed

'''[[Frozen Oceans]] '''
* No longer generate naturally.

=== Gameplay ===
'''Smooth lighting '''
* Added for:
** [[Bed]]s
** [[Fence]]s
** [[Cobblestone Wall]]s
** [[Cobweb]]
** [[Chest]]s
** [[Leaves]]
* Removed for:
** [[Glowstone]]
** [[Glass]]
** [[Jack o'Lantern]]s
** [[Redstone Ore|Lit Redstone Ore]]

=== General ===
'''[[Clouds]]'''
* New culling of clouds.
* The fog is darker underground.﻿

'''Textures'''
* Support for biome-tinted blocks

'''World list'''
* Now displays the storage size of each world.

'''Crafting screen'''
* New organized layout for the crafting screen
** Only shows craftable recipes.

'''Survival inventory '''
* New layout

'''View distance'''
* Now varies from device

=== Mobs ===
'''All mobs'''
* New spawning algorithm
* Lighter color when the mobs are hurt

'''Passive mobs '''
* Now spawn in little groups 
* Can spawn naturally in creative mode

'''[[Zombie]]s'''
* Mechanics changed
* When damaged, zombies have a low chance to spawn more zombies.

'''[[Spider]]s'''
* Now spawn from leaves
* Animation is twice as fast.

'''[[Creeper]]s'''
* Now walk faster.
* No longer float two pixels off the ground.

'''Other'''
* The [[options.txt]] file now reads the render distance as raw blocks.<ref>{{tweet|tomcc|427838605957275648|@aurisrimo in 0.9, options.txt contains the raw distance in blocks (ie. 256), feel free to experiment & destroy your battery life :D|27 Jan 2014}}</ref>
* Support for immersive mode (hides the on-screen navigation bar) for devices running Android 4.4 or higher.
* New LevelDB based saving format.
* New entity handling.
* Remade network code (mostly the same packages but new system).
* Tile entities are saved differently.
* New culling algorithm.
* Removed the [[camera]] entity
* Updated light generation
* No more client-side messages when a player joins
* "Edit" and "New" buttons no longer appear on the world select menu if "Play with touch" is disabled, making it impossible to create worlds without enabling the option.
* The Xperia Play touchpad can no longer be used to control the camera and [[crouch]]. Instead, it is used to move.
* In flight mode, the Xperia Play D-pad up and down buttons are always used to control the altitude, rather than only while the cross button is pressed.
** This requires to use the touchpad to move forwards and backwards during flight.
* Pause menu options on the Xperia Play can be selected with the D-pad and interacted with by pressing the cross button, though the selected option is not highlighted.

== Fixes ==
'''6 bugs fixed'''

'''From released versions before 0.9.0'''
* Mipmapping makes fire look like a big orange blob<ref>{{tweet|tomcc|425274565556584448|that’s actually true, will look into it :)|20 Jan 2014}}</ref>
* Minecart in multiplayer problems<ref>{{tweet|johan|422684282776481792|I will work on them for the next version. :)|13 Jan 2014}}</ref>
* Glitched name and description for [[baked potato]]es
* Crafting [[sign]]s only giving one unit
* Different wood types convert to same inside furnaces
* Fixed an item duplication glitch that could occur if the game crashed or if the player exited out of ''Minecraft'' without saving the world.</onlyinclude>
